title: EU consumers back call for more stringent eco-labels on confectionery and other food products - ConfectioneryNews.com
summary: The European Commission considers proposals to validate environmental claims and improve sustainability labelling, with support for a universal eco-label for food products.
green_innovation: FALSE Green innovation involves creating new products or processes that significantly reduce negative environmental impacts, while this article focuses on sustainability labelling and consumer transparency.

title: Nestlé invests £7 million into new hard-to-recycle plastics plant - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Nestlé and Impact Recycling have partnered to address the environmental impact of hard-to-recycle plastics in the food and beverage industry, investing in a new plastic recycling facility in the UK to handle flexible plastics. The innovative plastic recycling technology aims to create pellets from post-consumer mixed rigid plastic waste for reuse in products like postbags and refuse bags.
green_innovation: TRUE, The partnership between Nestlé and Impact Recycling to invest in a plastic recycling facility represents a green innovation as it focuses on developing a technology that tackles environmental challenges related to hard-to-recycle plastics in the food and beverage industry.
business_innovation: TRUE, The collaboration between Nestlé and Impact Recycling to invest in a new plastic recycling facility for handling hard-to-recycle plastics contributes to business innovation as it involves introducing a new process that significantly differs from previous methods used in the industry.
green_product: TRUE, The article discusses the development of a plastic recycling technology by Impact Recycling and Nestlé that aims to reduce the environmental impact of packaging waste by creating pellets from post-consumer mixed rigid plastic waste, thus qualifying as a green product.
green_process: TRUE, The article highlights Impact Recycling's innovative plastic recycling technology designed to process hard-to-recycle flexible plastics, promoting sustainability by minimizing environmental impacts in the handling of plastic waste.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 562112 - Hazardous Waste Collection
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not exhibit features of greenwashing as it transparently discusses the partnership between Nestlé and Impact Recycling to invest in a plastic recycling facility aimed at addressing environmental challenges related to hard-to-recycle plastics.

title: PepsiCo pushes entrepreneurial collaboration as 'vital' APAC sustainability strategy - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: PepsiCo launched a sustainability-focused accelerator program in the APAC region to find groundbreaking solutions for sustainable packaging and climate actions. The winner, Powered Carbon, developed technology to utilize carbon dioxide to produce eco-friendly fertilizers, aligning with PepsiCo's commitment to net zero and responsible growth.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes PepsiCo's initiative, which focuses on finding sustainable solutions for packaging and climate actions, showcasing a commitment to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. PepsiCo's sustainability-focused accelerator programs and the development of sustainable technology by Powered Carbon demonstrate a significant departure from traditional practices, marking a business innovation in the field.
green_product: TRUE. The article mentions eco-friendly fertilizers produced by Powered Carbon using carbon dioxide, showcasing a green product that reduces environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The article discusses Powered Carbon's technology to utilize carbon dioxide for producing eco-friendly fertilizers, demonstrating a green process that minimizes environmental impacts.

greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it focuses on real sustainability efforts and initiatives by PepsiCo and the accelerator program participants.

title: Mars rethinks recipes, ingredients on journey to Net Zero - FoodNavigator.com
